ygData.subject: Re: songs and pets
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Pets are treated as non-party members for our songs.  So if you are singing AE attack songs the pet will get hit, but not be effected by the song.  But you
ygData.messageBody:
>From: Jennifer McComb <mccomb@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: [eqbards] songs and pets
>Date: Fri, 18 Feb 2000 10:02:46 -0800
>
>Another newbie question here.
>
>My hubby has changed from playing a monk to playing a human shadowknight
>(he secretly plans on revolting from his God - shhh). Now that he can
>make a pet, I need to worry about what songs are bad to play when his
>pet is around. Do songs like the Chords of Dissonance affect the pet?
>Will the pet also run fast when I'm playing Selo's?
>
>Since I last posted, I've now acquired the 8th and 9th songs, and should
>be getting the 10th tonight or tomorrow. I'm finding it hard to save up
>the platinum for a combo sword (I've finally put aside smithing for
>awhile, but the tailoring habit is hard to break, with all those spider
>silks I'm looting.). Sing a song of patience for me.
>
>Jerrilia
>Bard of the 9th song
>Luclin


Pets are treated as non-party members for our songs. So if you are singing
AE attack songs the pet will get hit, but not be effected by the song. But
you will be added to the pets hate list, so if the pet's master goes LD the
pet will aggro on you.

Rokenn Swiftsong - Karana server

EQ Bard Song Analysis
http://rgonzalez.net/EQSongs/
